name: places/ChIJE8UOeU1YwokRu8cD3vH_iqY
formattedAddress: 475 W 41st St, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: 475 W 41st St, New York, NY 10036, USA

originalText.text: By far the worst parking lot in NYC! Attendants would not let us access our car to get medication. My girlfriend takes medication for her thyroid and left her spare meds in the car. Attendants laughed at us when we explained the situation and told us to go to a pharmacy. If you are staying in the surrounding hotels, the staff can’t help either because MPG is it’s own company. The parking staff are incredibly rude and lack serious customer service skills. I have never met a group of people that are so heartless. When we told them we were going to the car anyways, they chased us down and screamed at us the entire way. They told us it was impossible to access our car, OUR property. All to say, we found our car after searching for awhile and got what we needed, too bad for them we had the spare key. Avoid this place at all costs.

originalText.text: DO NOT RESERVE TO PARK HERE! I had two reservations for an event I was working. I made the reservation days in advance, and paid in full for both days. I arrived on time and promptly for my reservation. I was immediately turned away from the garage because the attendant said "the garage is completely full". I explained that I prepaid and showed my reservation. I was still turned away. They refused my service and told me to call their office. Well, I've been calling the office for a few days now and it's impossible to reach anyone. Why even have a reservation system just turn people away unless you're hoping to scam people? I'm currently filing a fraudulent payment with my bank, and the whole thing is ridiculous.

originalText.text: Horrendous experience.  Reserved here for comicon.  A line of 5 cars took them 90 minutes to clear.  Leaving me, and 2 kids and a wife in a car idling the entire time.  Myself and other patrons kept trying to walk out of our card and get answers and the mutants who work here couldn’t explain what was going on.  The kicker, the line of card eventually grows and grows and a car cuts off the line of people waiting 90 mins and they let him right in because and I quote “he always parks here”.  We missed out on almost 2 hours of comicon because 3 baboons took over 90 mins to park 5 cars.  When we return it was over 1 hour to get our car out.  These people clearly get paid hourly.  DO NOT PARK HERE!

originalText.text: If I could I would rate this as negative zero this was a horrible experience from the start I parked my car and the attendant never explained to me that once I park my car I could not take it out until I check out of the hotel I had a 2.5 day stay at the hotel the first morning I had an appointment at 9:30am when I came to get my car I was told if I took the car coming back I would have to pay an additional fee. On the last day I came to pick up my car from the garage I was told that I arrived one hour before the check out time. I had pay for 24 hour service when I approached the kiosk the attendant was talking on his walkie talkie he reached his hand I gave him the ticket and he held on to the ticket and kept on talking on the walkie talkie. He then scanned the ticket and said I owed $75. I told him that can’t be because I got a discount since I was a guest at YOTEL he told me I was one minute late so I had to pay an additional $25 but during that time he we were standing in line. This was horrible service if you can avoid this garage.

originalText.text: Car returned in a reasonable amount of time and in one piece. Two stars taken off b/c I chose this garage for its electric vehicle chargers. I clearly asked the attendant to charge the vehicle when he took it (as access to the chargers is NOT self-service. They’re behind the attendant station. See photo.) Vehicle was not charged upon receipt.
